the_problem.text: Patients with COVID-19 experience significant respiratory issues, resulting in coughing. Virus particles are easily spread in the fluids expelled from the patient during episodes of coughing. The face shield is an additional barrier between the healthcare worker and the patient, reduces the risk of viral transmission via airborne droplets, and reduces virus load on face masks worn underneath the face shield.

current_us_resources.text: Hospitals around the world continue to report shortages of face shields. [3/28/2020]

worst_case_expectation.text: Hospitals and clinicians will exhaust their supply of face shields and have no choice but to treat infectious patients without a face shield to reduce exposure to airborne droplets and contagious body fluids.

engineering_requirements.text:
Must provide complete coverage of the entire face, including the length of the face to the chin, and the sides of the face
Must have material across top of forehead to prevent ingress of liquids/droplets down the face and provide comfort
Must be able to be comfortably worn for long shifts (i.e. 12+ hours)
Adjustable band that is firmly attached around the head and clings closely to the forehead

assembly_fabrication_requirements.text: Clear polyester film 0.0007” thick (other thicknesses and materials such as PET, PETG, polycarbonate,  with anti-fog coating ideal)
Laser cutter or steel rule die
Note: Low-end manufacture possible with scissors, Xacto, stapler

projects_resources.text: Facebook Post to OSCMS Group- JustCreate Face Shield
OSHA Eye and Face Protection eTool
Design That Matters face shield resources

project_name.text: COVID19 Medical Face Shield (University of Wisconsin)

note.text: Recommended modifications: Non-latex elastic band; non-porous foam
Notes: Single use only, though disinfection of the plastic is possible with “Oxyvarin” Disinfectant (for McMAster Carr sourced PET, other brands may require different disinfectant).

reviewed_by.text: OSCMS Medical Review Team, Czech Ministry of Health

note.text: Prusa added a cover to their design; this addition further protects the wearer in instances of aerosolized droplets/virus. Some hospitals or clinicians will want to have the cover due to higher risk conditions; others may not need it.
